data.title: Output scheduler needs to check condition within to prevent race condition
data.body:
We now have a nice scheduler to prevent spam on the output panel, but I think at the time the scheduler executes we need to test again on all the conditions that you check before you schedule it because there is a chance that the output channel switches or the panel gets hidden after the scheduler has been scheduled. 

I think the isVisible() check should move up so that you return early if the output channel is not visible: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/output/common/outputEditorInput.ts#L76

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3926

data.title: Output gets buffered unbounded
data.body:
The buffered output should check itself for reaching the maximum and not just blindly add up: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/output/common/outputEditorInput.ts#L86

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3926

data.title: -w/--wait not working on ubuntu from zip
data.body:
- OS Version: ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. download latest code-alpha.zip
2. unzip
3. run in (default ubuntu terminal) <unzipped>/code-alpha
4. > it seems to be waiting without `--wait` option. also, `--help` isn't working. it always prints

```
bash: no job control in this shell
parallels@ubuntu:~/Downloads/VSCode-linux-x64$ ./code-alpha --help
bash: cannot set terminal process group (-1): Inappropriate ioctl for device
bash: no job control in this shell
parallels@ubuntu:~/Downloads/VSCode-linux-x64$ ^C
```

data.title: Debug console is closed when reloading extension host window

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code 0.10.12-alpha on OS X 10.11.3
- launch hello world extension from VS Code
  Observe: debug console appears and extension host windows opens
- "reload window" in extension host window
  Observe: window reloads and debug console disappears (most of the time)
  It seems that the 'closing timer' of the debug console is applied to the new debug console that appears after the session restart.

The debug console should stay open after a reload.

When using a "Restart" instead of the "Reload", the console doesn't close.

data.title: Indent: Configured tab size is not in the list if > 8
data.body:
Maybe show 1-8 and the configured one if it is above 8 so that the configured one is always in the list.

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3922

data.title: Leakage when refreshing explorer
data.body:
- open a workspace with ~40 files/folders in the root dir
- refresh the explorer
- take a heap snapshot
- refresh the explorer 10 times
- take another heap snapshot, heap grew by 0.1MB

data.title: Indent using Spaces / Tabs cannot be invoked more than once on a given file
data.body:
After I ran those actions once I cannot run them again and I get a message that the action is not enabled in the current context.

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3922

data.title: Indentation: Toggling view scrolls down a bit
data.body:
When I have spaces and toggle the view to have tabs, the content scrolls down:

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/13742845/96263e6e-e9de-11e5-962d-359eb745653a.gif)

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3922

data.title: OS X: VS Code does not honor locale
data.body:
VSCode 0.10.12-alpha
OS X 10.11.3
- switch to German:
  ![2016-03-14 12-09-53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/13742718/b36122c4-e9dd-11e5-93dc-771ec418e443.png)
- launch VS Code from Finder

Observe: VS Code UI is still in English

data.title: Indentation: Weird indentation in this case
data.body:
I have the default settings and a file like this with 6 leading spaces:

```
      "foo": "bar"
```

The status bar indicates to me that pressing tab will insert 1 tab, but when I press tab on the next line, I get mixed tab/whitespaces:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/13742697/9ca5ab72-e9dd-11e5-9a8c-54f23e3f9f70.png)

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3922

data.title: Add something besides command line option to configure locale
data.body:
Testing #4018

IMHO, there is a case not covered well enough. e.g.:
- having Windows locale in English and wanting to run VSCode in Spanish.
- or having Windows locale in Spanish and wanting to run VSCode in English.

The only way to do this now is to use a command line argument.

But especially in Windows, it is unusual to launch a UI app from the command line with arguments. E.g: taskbar, windows start button, double clicking a file associated with VSCode, right click open with VSCode.

I suggest some alternative means to define the locale besides the command line argument.

data.title: Indentation: Indicate to me mixed whitespace

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The indentation status bar entry seems like the right indicator to tell me when a file uses mixed spaces and tabs as so that I can take the right action to convert to either spaces or tabs.

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3922

data.title: Indentation: guessed 4 spaces when it should be 3?
data.body:
This might be intentional because we assume that indentation is always a multiplication by 2, but when I have a file with 3 spaces as indent and run the automated guessing, I end up with 4 spaces guessed. Similar 5 spaces gets guessed to 4 spaces as well.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/13742150/802da060-e9da-11e5-8d7a-23e3e4a3454a.png)

Checking with Sublime they seem to not detect anything and fallback to the default configured.

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3922

data.title: Add npm snippet to task creation templates
Release memory when intellisense hides

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- have a single JavaScript file with contents `do`
- trigger IntelliSense once, dismiss with escape
- take a heap snapshot
- repeat the IntelliSense/dismiss cycle ~10 times
- take another heap snapshot, mem usage grew by 1,5MB

data.title: We changed our default indent from spaces to tabs and should announce this properly
data.body:
We seem to have changed the default from 4 spaces to 4 tabs and this will cause issues for any project that left the default settings in expecting new files to get spaces and not tabs.

I hope release notes are good enough, but I have a feeling this might backfire badly to us.

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3922

data.title: Extension Errors are clipped and stacked
data.body:
Testing #4024 
- VSCode Version: Alpha
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create several extension issues (e.g. remove the package.json from an extension)
2. restart code 
3. open the extension status bar item

Each error is shown in a separate message box and the error message is clipped

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/13741208/597ece8a-e9d5-11e5-9d58-b7f22979776b.png)

Suggest to show the error messages in the output window and an extension-errors channel.

FYI: @joaomoreno

data.title: Extension status bar animation does not fit well
data.body:
I find the animation for the extension status bar entry does not fit well with the other animation we use for git where we just keep the icon but indicate progress through animation. 

I suggest to go back to how it was before so that the icon is still visible but just animated.

cc @egamma 

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4024

data.title: Animate extension status bar when there are messages
data.body:
I am not sure people will discover the extension status bar entry when it has errors or update infos available. Why not animate the thing right on startup (shake it a bit?) for a period of time in case there are errors or updates so that it draws attention to the user?

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4024

data.title: How to generate xxx.i18n.json
data.body:
It`s great that vscode supports internationalization. I want to know how to generate and edit
the json files in the https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/tree/master/i18n. 
Is there a tool? Is it open source?

data.title: Suggest: Show Outdated Extensions => Show Extension Updates
data.body:
I find it much easier to understand what the action does because it is about updates and not about outdates :)

Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4024

data.title: [tslint][Extension] Unable to install tslint extension from the extension recommendations list.
data.body:
OS: WIndows10
Build:0.10.12-alpha
Steps:
1. Launch an app and open folder for "starter Azure node Express 3" app.
2. Open app.ts and click on extension info icon from the status bar.
3. Select option for "Show Extension Recommendations".
4. try to Install tslinit extension.

Actual: 
1. There is no alert of successful or failure.
2. When I verified in the installed extension tslint is missing.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13740122/34c7a0ce-e98c-11e5-9629-23fe98105956.png)
3. After some time when I check "Show Extension Recommendations"  I could see tslint is showing up again as a recommendation.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13740039/d2791bb4-e98b-11e5-8f88-709fdf725681.png)

Expected:
User should get a notification whether extension installed successfully or not.

data.title: Decide on our version in package.json for March
data.body:
We need to decide if we go to 1.0 as version in our package.json for the March release. If we do, we probably have to tweak the code we have to detect if an extension is valid or not.

/cc @Microsoft/vscode

data.title: First debug start has no effect if 'preLaunchTask' is watching
data.body:
1. Have a `launch.json` with a 'preLaunchTask' that is watching
2. Start debugging - no effect, only the second start does the job

data.title: Distinguish extension install vs. update in telemetry
Reload when debugging an extension does not always reconnect debug session
data.body:
1. Create a 'hello world' VSCode extension
2. Start to debug that extension from VSCode, a secondary window will be launched
3. Reload the seconday window, VSCode does not always reconnect. Sometimes it does, sometimes not so it might be a timing issue

I did not touch code in this area, so giving first to you. Give back to me if you think it is on the vscode side - I quickly checked and did not find anything very obvious.

data.title: Test Tour: Go
data.body:
- install the Go extension
- develop Go code
- debug

data.title: [html] Why editor.action.smartSelect is not working in html file?
data.body:
I can not use `editor.action.smartSelect.grow` and `editor.action.smartSelect.shrink` functions to working on html file. I don't think the develop team have any reason to disable them on html file. It's should be working on any file!! Any body know why?
Please fix it!
Thanks!

data.title: Request: Linter messages are shown without mouse hover

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When the linter found something in code, a red-wave-line is shown at that part of the code.
I can read the message from the linter by moving a mouse cursor to there, or pressing Ctrl+Shift+M.
But, I hope the message that can be read without moving mouse or command. For example, the message about a current line is shown in a status bar.
